item.title: Time and Linux
item.description: Is dual boot messing up your date and time? Universal Time or UTC is primary time standard by which the world regulates clock and time. GMT is timezone and UTC is time standard. RTC Time is run by your computer even when you don’t power the device through the use of CMOS battery. It is also known as hardware clock. System Clock is maintained by operating system The time that UNIX type system stores on hardware clock is UTC The time that Windows type system stores on hardware clock is system clock time.
